description: Four victorious figures, wearing horned helmets and armor, huddle amidst a field of fallen warriors and scattered weapons. They are chanting a cheer typically associated with sports teams showing appreciation. This scene creates an absurd and darkly humorous contrast between brutal combat and a celebratory, almost mundane ritual. The irony lies in performing a cheer of appreciation on a battlefield covered in the dead. The specific cheer highlights the surreal nature of the moment.
caption: "Two, four, six, eight, who do we appreciate ..."
